883.question: Do the methods that work best on academic papers also work best on Wikipedia?

4-Table1-1.png: Yes, the methods that work best on academic papers also work best on Wikipedia. This is evident as the methods 'Ours', 'Peer Review', and 'Our+Peer Review' have the highest performance scores on Wikipedia compared to the other datasets.</s>

Based on the table, the methods that work best on academic papers, which are 'Ours', 'Peer Review', and 'Our+Peer Review', also have the highest results on Wikipedia. This suggests that these methods are effective across different types of datasets, including Wikipedia.</s>

884.question: What is their system's absolute accuracy?
884.answer: 59.4% on wikipedia dataset, 93.4% on peer-reviewed archive AI papers, 77.1%  on peer-reviewed archive Computation and Language papers, and 79.9% on peer-reviewed archive Machine Learning papers

4-Table2-1.png: They use English, French, German, and Spanish.</s>
The languages used in the table are English (EN), German (DE), French (FR), and Spanish (ES).</s>
